command: $feed = Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing 'https://threatintel.example.local/feeds/newly-registered-domains.json' -TimeoutSec 10; $list = ($feed.Content | ConvertFrom-Json).domains; $cached = (Get-DnsClientCache).Name; $matches = $cached | Where-Object { $list -contains $_ }; $out = @{ when=(Get-Date).ToUniversalTime().ToString('o'); hits=$matches } | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3; Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing -ContentType 'application/json' -Method POST -Body $out 'https://siem.example.local/api/ingest/newreg-hits'
explanation: Defensive correlation for T1568: cross-references cached domains with a feed of newly registered domains (often used in dynamic resolution) and reports any hits.
rationale_steps: Fetch a vetted feed of newly registered domains via Invoke-WebRequest.
Compare the feed against the local DNS cache.
Package and send any overlaps to SIEM for triage.
